result.execSummary:
The defendant M. L. T. Dale was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. M. L. T. Dale is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • M. L. T. Dale was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • M. L. T. Dale was found guilty of Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • M. L. T. Dale was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • M. L. T. Dale was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • M. L. T. Dale was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
**Joint & Several**

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge. 
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $2000   plus surcharges.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations.  May not have contact with Jermaine Gooch, Annette Vartcher, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  Obtain & maintain a stable residence.

Certified and dated August 14, 2019 -- IT IS ORDERED that the petition for a writ of habeas corpus is granted; IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that petitioner may file with the clerk of this court a petition for review from the adverse court of appeals' decision issued on November 14, 2018, in State v. Dale, No. 2017AP1569-CRNM, no later than 30 days from the date of this order.  State ex rel. Schmelzer v. Murphy, 201 Wis., 2d 246, 548 N.W.2D 45 (1996).

Dated August 14, 2019 - IT IS ORDERED that the petition for a writ of habeas corpus is granted; IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that petitioner may file with the clerk of this court a petition for review from the adverse court of appeals' decision issued on November 14, 2018, in State v. Dale, No. 2017AP1569-CRNM, no later than 30 days from the date of this order.  State ex rel. Schmelzer v. Murphy, 201 Wis. 2d 246, 548 N.W.2d 45 (1996).

Dated June 12, 2019 - IT IS ORDERED that M.L.T. Dale file with this court, within 20 days of the date of this order, copies of attachments #1 and #2 referenced in paragraph 8 of Mr. Dale's January 11, 2019 affidavit.

Dated February 5, 2019 - IT IS ORDERED that the court grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee. This order waives on the filing fees in the Supreme Court. It is not a determination of indignecy for any other purpose. Indigency may be reevaluated if a request is received for waiver of other fees based on indigency.

285 days sentence credit given. Conditions of extended supervision given. Court costs ordered. Restitution stipulated to in the amount of $2,000. Defendant is NOT eligible for the CIP and SAP programs. Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant. Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge. Appeal rights given.

District Attorney Robert Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Terry Rose. Clerk LE. Preliminary hearing held jointly with 14CF777. State offers and Court receives exhibits S-1, S-2, S-3, S-4, S-5, and S-6. Probable cause found. State to file information within statutory time limits. Arraignment on 8-14-14 @ 1:00pm.
